quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Doctors and Following Doctors
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these countries joined the United Nations organization in 2006?
What do we call the ratio of a circles circumference to its diameter?
This physician has been trained in the diagnosis and management of kidney disease.

While sitting at home talking with friends, you all of a sudden start slurring your words, and develop an inability to move your right arm and leg. The services of which of the following doctors are you likely to seek first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emergency Medicine doctor

questions.question: Which of the following doctors is least likely to ever be on call?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emergency Physician

questions.question: Which medical specialty largely replaced the old general practice specialty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Family Practice

questions.question: Which is the correct version of the joke about these four medical specialists?

options.text: A psychiatrist knows nothing and does nothing. An internist knows everything and does nothing. A pathologist knows nothing and does everything. A surgeon knows everything, and does everything--but too late!

A psychiatrist knows nothing and does nothing. A pathologist knows everything and does nothing. An internist knows nothing and does everything. A surgeon knows everything, and does everything--but too late!

A psychiatrist knows nothing and does nothing.  An internist knows everything and does nothing. A surgeon knows nothing and does everything. A pathologist knows everything, and does everything--but too late!

A psychiatrist knows nothing and does nothing. A pathologist knows everything and does nothing. A surgeon knows nothing and does everything.  An internist knows everything, and does everything--but too late!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A psychiatrist knows nothing and does nothing.  An internist knows everything and does nothing. A surgeon knows nothing and does everything. A pathologist knows everything, and does everything--but too late!

questions.question: Which type of doctor deals with removing hemorrhoids?
Which of these terms refers to a bone surgeon?
In the United States, which of the following doctors is likely to make the most money?
Which of these doctors is qualified to treat alcohol withdrawal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: When was the United Nations founded?
What continent has the highest human population density on Earth as estimated in 2007?
By 2004, how many people had been outside Earths atmosphere?
This kind of doctor is an expert in such diseases as Lupus, Sjogrens Syndrome, and Dermatomyositis.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Numbers and Set
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, coin, sets. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these three sets is the largest: the set of all whole numbers, the set of all even numbers, the set of  all odd numbers?

options.text: The set of all even numbers
The set of all whole numbers
The set of all odd numbers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are the same size

questions.question: Ambien (zolpidem) is used to treat which one of the following conditions?
Which great 20th century mathematician died because he refused to eat ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kurt Godel

questions.question: Which disease is treated by Synthroid (levothyroxine)?
Which of the following medications treats depression?
Going in a circle counter-clockwise is called left-handed. Why ?

options.text: It is the way that hurricane winds blow
Newton called it that way so we follow his way
If you turn counter-clockwise your left hand is nearer the center

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: If you turn counter-clockwise your left hand is nearer the center

questions.question: In general, mathematicians consider these three men to have been the greatest mathematicians of all times.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archimedes, Newton, Gauss

questions.question: If you multiplied all the whole numbers together, what would the answer be ?
What do we call the square root of negative one?
Which one of the following medications treats Alzheimers Disease (dementia)?
Which of these could be an answer to a math problem involving volume?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8 cubic inches

questions.question: What do we call these numbers:  0, 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36, 49, etc?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: square numbers

questions.question: What do we call the base for natural logarithms ?
Which of the following disease does Propecia (finasteride) treat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hair loss

questions.question: If you flip a fair coin three times what is the probability you will get three heads ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: one out of eight

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Blood and Heart
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, botox, diseases. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of the following medications reduces cholesterol?
All arteries carry oxygenated blood from the heart to the rest of the body.
Tarsals are located in what part of the body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Foot or eyelid

questions.question: Name the anastomotic loop of vessels near the base of the brain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Circle of Willis

questions.question: Which of the following describes the route of pulmonary circulation?

options.text: L atria to R pulmonary artery to R lung
L. ventricle to L pulmonary artery to L lung
R ventricle to R pulmonary artery to R lung
R. ventricle to R. and L. pulmonary arteries to R  L lung

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: R. ventricle to R. and L. pulmonary arteries to R  L lung

questions.question: Which of these terms refer to the chambers of the heart -- the two on top and the two on the bottom respectively?

options.text: Atria and Ventricle, Atria and Ventricle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atria and Ventricles

questions.question: Bones in the wrists are called by what name?
Portal circulation refers to the circulation of blood returning from the body and entering the heart through semilunar portals.
Where is the radial artery located?
Arterial blood is blue due to oxygenation. Venous blood is bright red and spurts when a person receives a cut.
Which of the following medications is for enuresis (bed-wetting)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: DDAVP (Arginine Vasopressin)

questions.question: Valtrex (valacyclovir) treats which one of the following conditions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Genital herpes

questions.question: Botox (botulinum toxin) is used to treat which one of the following diseases?
Where is the femoral artery located?
Which of the following drugs thins the blood?  (That is, it decreases the ability of the blood to clot.)

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Term and Animal
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, suns, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What place has the maximum amount of sunshine in the US?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yuma, Arizona

questions.question: This term refers to a division of the psyche dominated by the pleasure principle.
This syndrome or disorder occurs after a very traumatic event and has intense symptoms such as reliving the event over and over.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Post Traumatic Stress Disorder

questions.question: Right-handed people live longer than left-handed people.
Sublimation means channeling an urge in another direction.
How often does Halleys comet appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Every 76 years

questions.question: What animal has the broadest visual color spectrum?
Which animal has the longest gestation period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Salamander

questions.question: Which natural disaster claimed the most lives during the second millennium?
Which of the following travels at the speed of light?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: How much does human hair grow in a year?
What is the largest number mentioned in the Bible?
This complex is a phase in child development characterized by jealousy and rivalry with the same sex parent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oedipal complex

questions.question: This term is commonly used to refer to a person who becomes overly upset or angry when confronted with an issue.
How long on average does it take for the suns rays to reach earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: just over 8 minutes

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Dna and Cell
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, process, photosynthesis. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these is not among the vacuoles functions in the cell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Production of ATP

questions.question: Transcription is the process of creating what from the DNA template?
What is the three-letter acronym for the Nobel-winning process which allows DNA to be amplified?
What is the name for a unit of DNA usually consisting of regulatory regions and a protein-encoding region?
The process of photosynthesis is carried out by which of these major cell organelles?
Which of the following models of double-stranded DNA replication proved to be correct?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Semiconservative replication

questions.question: How many paired DNA chromosomes are there in a human male?
Of the four nucleotides that make up Deoxyribo-Nucleic Acid (DNA), which of the following is a purine?
This class of enzyme can cut DNA at a specific place, making biotechnology possible.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Restriction Enzyme

questions.question: What makes retroviruses such as HIV so unusual with respect to DNA?

options.text: Their DNA reads 3 to 5, the opposite direction from cellular DNA.
They capture the cellular DNA and transfer it to other cells.
They have no DNA, but their protein components directly encode for RNA.
They start with RNA and encode DNA, the reverse of what cells do.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They start with RNA and encode DNA, the reverse of what cells do.

questions.question: The cell has up to several thousands of these tiny organelles scattered in its cytoplasm. They are often called cellular power plants, because they convert organic materials into energy.
Plastids are major cell organelles found in which of these groups of organisms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plants and algae

questions.question: When Dr. Craig Venters private company, Celera, declared that they would beat the Human Genome Project in sequencing all human DNA, what did Venter tell Dr. Francis Collins, director of the HGP?

options.text: Just send me all your grant money.
Why dont you try something easier?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You can do mouse.

questions.question: The Golgi apparatus found in most eukaryotic cells participates in the sorting and modification of what type of organic compounds?
How many nucleotides of DNA does it take to encode a single amino acid in a given protein?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Cells and Organelles
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, kind, lysosomes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the biggest artery in the human body?
Dental caries, commonly known as a cavity, is one of the most common health disorders, second only to this one.
Typical for the animal cells only, lysosomes are organelles built in the Golgi apparatus that contain what type of enzymes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Digestive enzymes

questions.question: Which one of these organelles is a part of the endomembrane system of eukaryotic cells?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Endoplasmic reticulum

questions.question: This is one of the first symptoms of dental caries.  It is most pronounced when consuming sweet, hot or cold foods and liquids.
Plaque and bacteria begin to accumulate approximately this long after eating.
Which organelle makes up the cells translational apparatus that translates Messenger RNA (mRNA) into polypeptide chains?
Cell nuclei have two primary functions in the cell. The first is to to store genetic information needed for cellular division. What is the second one?

options.text: To maintain an acidic internal pH
To remove unwanted structural debris surrounding the cell

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To control chemical reactions

questions.question: What kind of cells carry oxygen around your body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: red blood cells

questions.question: This term refers to the organs that fill your abdominal cavity and chest.
A caries is formed as a result of food debris. Food remnants mix with saliva and bacteria, and result into this mixture that glues to the teeth.
It is said that the average person has about six pounds of skin.
Which of the following organelles is typical for animal cells only?
Name he glands that produce hormones.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: endocrine glands

questions.question: What part of the nervous system regulates involuntary actions such as heartbeat or digestion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: autonomic nervous system
